result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward W. Moffitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.  If cannot make it to probation office today, defendant needs to call by 9:00 am tomorrow morning 9/30/2016.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Nicole Hager of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward W. Moffitt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Edward W. Moffitt appeared, pro se.    Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 29, 2016 at 03:50 pm.

Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, Edward W. Moffitt appeared, pro se  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 03:50 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with N.H.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way except for incidental contact related to living in the same apartment building.     Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.
